title: (x) Extended, thin and neat-o. Any ideas, please?! - Lonestar aka Hellenic Wide {Ben M, Eric H}
content:
I've seen this around but have only managed to find a really bad imitation. Anyone got this? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/typophile.com/files/1_29.jpg) | 7.99 KB |
| [2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/typophile.com/files/2_29.jpg) | 45.67 KB |
| [Namethis.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/typophile.com/files/Namethis_0.jpg) | 40.46 KB |
author: bleachmilk

comments.content: Perfect! Yeah also found [Archive Antique Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-antique-extended/) but was looking for the clean version. Thanks.

This one goes by [Hellenic Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/www.identifont.com/show?OOZ), too. I almost want to say that's the old-school name for it, but I don't have any documentation to back that up.

i had a classmate that was a fan of Hellenic Wide, and of ISO50  
 [http://www.merchline.com/storeimages/ISO50-TB3-Poster.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100206214752/http:/www.merchline.com/storeimages/ISO50-TB3-Poster.jpg)  
its really pretty nice if used well
I've seen that before. I'd really love an opportunity to use that font in print.
Oh wow. There are like 5 different versions by different people. Veer's lowercase looks more resolved. Thanks for the head's up.
